page.title: 03Transport in Flint
page.content: The{main coast road}linking the Midlands to the coastal resorts of North Wales passes through the town of Flint bringing frequent{traffic jams} especially during the summer months with the{tourist traffic.}As a result the County Council are planning a {bypass.}Two routes are being considered- the{Brown route}through farm land, and the{Blue route}which crosses waste land between the Estuary and the Castle. We decided to{debate} the issue in school with pupils playing the part of Councillors. The {farmers}in class were worried that their farms would be demolished. James, a boy in class 4, objected to the Blue route because of the danger to the{foundations}of the Castle. The {final decision}was in favour of the Blue route, crossing the marsh land. I wonder what the council will decide?
